intro: Anthospermum ciliare var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved anthospermum, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
